subject: AI & Agents
title: Reinforcement Learning: Trial, Error, Reward
description: One-minute skill: Reinforcement Learning: Trial, Error, Reward.

hook.text: A robot tries to walk. It falls. It gets a negative reward. It tries again slightly differently. Better.

buildup.text: Reinforcement learning trains agents through interaction with an environment and reward signals.

discovery.text: The agent explores, receives rewards or penalties, and adjusts its strategy to maximize total reward.

twist.text: RL agents can discover strategies no human ever imagined â€” like AlphaGo's famous Move 37.

climax.text: RL trains game-playing AIs, robot controllers, and recommendation algorithms.

punchline.text: Fall down seven times. Stand up eight. That's reinforcement learning.

quiz.question: How does reinforcement learning differ from supervised learning?
options: It learns from rewards through interaction, not from labeled examples
